metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8037 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ppp decapsulator in tcpdump 4.9.3 can be convinced to allocate a large amount of memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-8037` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.99.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.99.0-2').
